Instrument.name: Vector Helium/Fluxgate Magnetometers for ULY
Instrument.description: The Ulysses space probe, the first to explore the out-of-ecliptic heliosphere, investigates the three-dimensional structure of the interplanetary magnetic field. Its magnetometer, comprising a Vector Helium Magnetometer and a Fluxgate Magnetometer, measures the magnetic field vector with high sensitivity and time resolution. Since its activation on October 25, 1990, it has continuously collected data, revealing disturbances in the magnetic field, including shock waves and wave activity, particularly during this phase of the solar cycle. The text summarizes the scientific goals of the investigation and provides a detailed instrument description, along with examples of observed phenomena.
